comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Canadian actress Dai Turgeon married author Charles Belmont Davis in London in January 1914; she was 22, he was 48. www.ibdb.com/person.php?id=62783

comment.author: 83477474@N05
comment._content: Does anyone have any further information on this young lady?

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Dai Turgeon Davis (c. 1891- ), daughter of Charles Edward Turgeon and Maud Higginson Turgeon, divorced Charles Belmont Davis after seven years of marriage (he died in 1926). Charles Belmont Davis was the brother of Richard Harding Davis, who is also found in the LOC uploads: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/6904542030/] Dai's sister-in-law, Mrs. Richard Harding Davis, was also a performer: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/6689616583/] She probably wouldn't have met her mother-in-law, who died in 1910: www.csustan.edu/english/reuben/pal/chap5/davis.html

comment.author: 73300269@N05
comment._content: She's my grandmother. She married three times. My father was her son, and only child, by her third husband, Elmer Newton.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks so much pennylrichardsca for your research into this woman.  A lovely photograph of your grandmother, newtchris!
